title: Proper formatting when sending RTL/BiDi messages
body:
### Checklist - [X] I have used the search function to see if someone else has already submitted the same feature request. - [X] I will describe the problem with as much detail as possible. - [X] This issue only contains a request for one single feature, **not** multiple (related) features. ### App version 6.400 ### Problem you are trying to solve I'd like to be able to send messages containing RTL/BiDi text, which will be rendered correctly by the receiver. Currently, when I send such messages, they render correctly only in k9 itself (and that only under specific circumstances), but not, e.g., in Gmail. It's actually a bit complicated, so bear with me... RTL languages (such as Hebrew / Arabic / Persian) are written right-to-left -- this refers both to the fact that the text is aligned to the right rather than to the left, as well as the fact that the second letter of a word is written to the left of the first letter, and the second word is written to the left of the first word, etc. When mixing RTL and LTR text in the same paragraph, things are even more complicated. Proper rendering of such text is done by the BiDi (bidirectional) algorithm. Specifically (and simplifying a bit), part of the algorithm is that the paragraph direction is determined by the language of the first character. In the following examples, "אבג" is the first logical word, with its first letter being "א" (Hebrew letter Aleph). The second word is "abc", and the third word is "דהו". As explained above, since the first character is in Hebrew (an RTL language) , the entire paragraph should be aligned to the right. When *composing* the message in k9, it renders correctly: ![t1-compose-k9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206689673-3fb50c02-a2fa-4901-ba5e-e71710f4dff6.png) Note that the first word (אבג) is rightmost, followed (moving from right-to-left) by the second word (abc) and then the third (דהו). Also, the entire paragraph is aligned to the right. However, when *viewing* the received message in k9, it does not display correctly: ![t1-view-k9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206691308-8267ae32-6978-4d24-bb0f-687384b19652.png) Not only is the entire text aligned to the left, but also the first word appears left-most, rather than right-most. The received message is also rendered incorrectly when viewed in gmail: ![t1-view-gmail](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206691954-737dc370-dc69-4e3e-b617-d73606a2afcd.png) On the other hand, when trying the same test from Gmail, it displays correctly all along -- displays correctly while composing it in gmail: ![t3-compose-gmail](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206692209-9af61a72-3fb8-4f4b-a428-7a2b724619f0.png) renders correctly after being received in gmail: ![t3-view-gmail](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206692276-a836479c-d78e-4890-a746-c6ee684d3467.png) and also renders correctly when viewed in k9: ![t3-view-k9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206692360-294572a6-ccef-4305-82a6-87359d1b869b.png) Note that both messages are composed in HTML/RTF format. However, when inspecting the messages, it can be seen that the one composed by gmail conatins html "dir" attributes (showing only the text/html part of the message): ``` Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
=D7=90=D7=91=D7=92 abc =D7=93= =D7=94=D7=95
``` whereas the one composed by k9 does not: ``` Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable =D7=90=D7=91=D7=92 abc =D7=93=D7=94=D7=95= ``` As I started looking into whether this issue has already been reported, I came across a bunch of issues which seemingly *were* related -- especially #3391 and the associated PR #4841 -- however, although they are marked as fixed, clearly a problem still persists. So continuing to investigate, I noticed that the above fix is applying the "dir" attribute to a `
` element. So I tried the same tests with plaintext-formatted messages, with the following results: while composing the message in k9, all is good:
![t2-compose-k9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206695560-ca27c8bc-b2c0-43d2-82cf-4a186d3740a1.png)
And now, also when viewing the received message in k9, it is rendered correctly!
![t2-view-k9](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206695674-efcee0a8-d44f-41b4-bb56-8d9de01a5c0e.png)
However, when viewed in gmail it still renders incorrectly:
![t2-view-gmail](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/830975/206695783-0da9b0f3-3f4b-485e-94f9-58911dbc536c.png)

The sent message is, truly, plaintext, so no formatting instructions can be applied to it. It is rendered correctly by k9 because the above-mentioned fix forces `

title: Message view redesign
body: We're currently working on a new design for the message view. A (non-final) preview can be seen below. ### Current state ### Preview ![Message header - HiFi - no download](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/218061/190913577-e27dd2f1-6b93-4a7b-a332-3cb3ada070f6.png) Notes on the image: - The chip containing "Thunderbird Ryan" is the name of the account the message belongs to. The chip is colored using the account color. It will only be displayed if there's more than one account. - The text below the chip is the subject of the message. - The circle-shaped image is the contact picture of the sender of the message. - The text at the top of the gray area, to the right of the contact picture is the name of the sender. - To the right we have a reply action and an overflow menu containing more actions. - Below the sender name there's information about the recipients. If the account only has one identity and the message was addressed to it, "to me" will be displayed. If the account has multiple identities the text that is shown will be "to <name of identity>". If the message was addressed to someone else their display name will be shows. For now at most two recipient names will be displayed. If there's more recipients "+x" will be shown. - If a crypto provider is enabled for the account, an encryption indicator is displayed in front of the recipient text. - The "Important, Todo, Work" text is labels added to the message. This won't be relevant until #769 is implemented. - The "show remote images" button is not final and might move and/or change appearance. Tapping any part of the gray area other than the action buttons on the right (reply, overflow menu), will open a bottom sheet containing details about the message. ![Message header - Bottom Drawer HiFi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/218061/190913663-8bb66aa2-3bbc-4b31-8479-21d770af4d73.png) If there are a lot of recipients the bottom sheet can be dragged up to make it cover the whole screen. In that case we intend to provide a way to search/filter the recipient list. ### Feedback We're still working on the design. But if you're missing a feature or have other feedback, please let us know in a comment. --- ### Initial design considerations A message view redesign should include the following features: - #6180 And it should keep in mind these features that we want to add further down the line: - #6181 Email addresses need to be far enough apart so tapping them reliably is not a problem. - #1119 We probably want to display the email address below the name and then hide the recipient addresses. - #769 Figure out where to display them. - #762 Figure out where to display the folder name(s) (JMAP supports messages living in multiple folders). - #6197 All of the per-message information/actions should live in the message header area, because at some point we'll want to display more than one message in this view. We need some touch area that collapses/expands the whole message. - #1397 We need an overflow menu or some other place to put (less important) per-message actions like this. This is what the message view looks like in other apps… Gmail: Outlook: FairEmail: EDIT 2022-09-18: Updated with latest design.

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Spam messages are generally bulk-deleted (even after reviewing and moving false positives to another folder). Thus, there's an extra tap involved when having to Select All and then Delete messages in the Spam folder.

A single-tap Empty Spam action (even in the overflow menu would be fine). This would be akin to Thunderbird's Empty Junk action when right-clicking the folder that's designated as the Junk folder in T-bird.

title: "Waiting for new emails" notification should use low priority
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

First of all, congrats on the 5.800 release! It's clear it was a long road to get here, but it looks and works great.

A family member is stuck on an older version of Android (7.1) and is finding the new push "waiting for new emails" notification annoying. It appears with normal priority (so it's interleaved with all of their other notifications) and it doesn't appear possible to disable it without disabling _all_ notifications for K-9 (which would sort of defeat the purpose of having push enabled in the first place).

We took a look at the documentation [for silencing or disabling the notification](https://forum.k9mail.app/t/how-to-configure-push/1102/1#notification-3), but these instructions don't appear to apply to Android 7.1 or below. Specifically, there doesn't appear to be a mechanism for granularly disabling or silencing specific kinds of notifications from an app -- it's all or nothing.

The notification on Android 7.1 looks like the one covered in the FAQ post:

![ss1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/567041/128258318-d837de77-3de0-4512-8afa-42c7799db649.png)

However, long-pressing the notification reveals this menu instead of one that allows you to toggle individual notification types:

![ss2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/567041/128258559-73eed04e-d2aa-4df4-b8ce-ab36ffbdd3f9.png)

The "More Settings" option doesn't offer more granular configurability either:

![ss3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/567041/128258649-c56f75c3-8dc2-4105-8bca-ff51a6321314.png)


**Describe the solution you'd like**

Other apps seem to solve this problem by using low-priority notifications. For example, when [Signal](https://www.signal.org/) is running in an environment without Play Services, it'll spawn a persistent notification similar to K-9's. However, the notification doesn't have an icon that appears in the status bar -- you have to pull down the notification shade to see it at all -- and it appears at the very bottom of the notification list, in a slightly dimmed colour:

![ss4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/567041/128259232-b5453345-f1cb-446c-9d81-668b58f33762.png)

Signal _message_ notifications, of course, appear with normal priority.

Absent any way to hide specific kinds of notifications for a given app on older versions of Android, having K-9 do this seems like it would be the best and least obtrusive solution.

In case it helps, I took a quick look in Signal's code -- [this appears to be the method and parameter in question](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/1a56924a56a191a1271ba70b2e12a3af3ad289bc/app/src/main/java/org/thoughtcrime/securesms/messages/IncomingMessageObserver.java#L275), using `androidx.core.app.NotificationCompat.Builder`. The [docs for the method](https://developer.android.com/reference/androidx/core/app/NotificationCompat.Builder#setPriority(int)) explain:

> On platforms `Build.VERSION_CODES.O` and above this value is ignored in favor of the importance value set on the notification's channel. **On older platforms, this value is still used, so it is still required for apps supporting those platforms.**

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

The family member could disable push and enable polling instead. (This is slightly annoying, since push/IDLE seemed to work fine on previous versions of K-9 without the notification, with battery optimizations disabled. My understanding is that the notification is necessary specifically for new versions of Android, which is fair enough.)

Or they could roll back to an older version of K-9. This would definitely be a shame -- and probably not ideal long-term for security and maintenance -- but would fix the notification annoyance.

title: De-emphasize signature when displaying text/plain part
body:
Use grey text to display a message signature like e.g. Thunderbird does it.

Example:
![screenshot](http://gotopinion.info/wiki/images/4/47/ThunderbirdSignature01.png)
Image source: http://gotopinion.info/wiki/images/4/47/ThunderbirdSignature01.png (via Google image search)

**Notes for implementers**:
* The new `HtmlModification` mechanism can be used for that. However, we need to support nested `WRAP` instances because we still want to linkify URIs in a signature.
* De-emphasizing the signature text has to work with both the light and the dark theme. So we can't just hardcode a font color.

title: Add proper dir and align attributes when using RTL languages
body:

When sending an email with RTL languages (Hebrew, Arabic, etc), the dir and text-align HTML attributes should be "right" in the content's element.

There is no dir and text-align HTML attributes in the content's element, and the text aligned by the email client default settings. In the composing editor the text appears fine, from right to left, but only on the composer level, and not in the HTML level.

title: Display larger preview of image attachments
body:
I review a ton of security camera footage. The pics come to me by email. This is what attached images are currently displayed like in K9:
![screenshot_20170107-125805](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1756255/21745198/8c73fd92-d4da-11e6-85fa-6f1df7218f50.png)

It would be monumentally awesome if you guys simply changed the proportions of the same data, to behave a little more like gmails does, for the sake of being able to see more of the image. This would save folks in my boat a ton of time/clicks/taps :D

![screenshot_20170107-125756](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1756255/21745209/df0ed11c-d4da-11e6-8e00-94872798c724.png)


Hopefully this isn't a huge, massive change. And hopefully other users will agree with it! Otherwise, perhaps an option in the settings to change how inline images are displayed?

Thanks in advance!

title: Don't update crypto mode right away
body:
![screenshot_k9mail_crypto_dialog_slider_release_changes_preference_immediately](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/218061/18233762/dd7243a4-72ef-11e6-844f-e0218a9dbb0c.png)

The crypto mode changes the moment the slider is released, not when the "Proceed" button is pressed. This makes it impossible to cancel the selection by pressing the back button or dismissing the dialog by clicking somewhere outside of it.

title: Use active color for "Never Sign or Encrypt"
body:
![screenshot_k9mail_never_sign_or_encrypt_no_highlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/218061/18233739/6d078a2a-72ef-11e6-9875-ebe823409091.png)

The "Never Sign or Encrypt" icon has no active color unlike all the other icons in that dialog. I think a slightly darker grey would work fine.

title: Dialog is shown every time "Enable PGP/INLINE" is selected
body:
![screenshot_k9mail_enable_pgp_inline_dialog](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/218061/18233635/dae152b8-72ec-11e6-8a61-96b3b9d90251.png)

This gets old fast. We should display the dialog maybe 2-3 times and then assume the user knows what it's all about and not show the dialog anymore.

PS: The light area in the background is where the keyboard used to be before the dialog was displayed.

title: Add sender name to contacts
body:
It would be helpful, if the "add to contacts" function would not only pass the e-mail address, but also the real name to a new contact.

Example:
If there is an e-mail in the inbox from
"Dr. Susan Miller (Veterinarian)" mail@susan-dogs-and-cats.com
K9 mail right now only imports
mail@susan-dogs-and-cats.com
to a new contact. To add the real name to this new contact, you would have to go the complicated way of changing back to k9 mail, copying the real name (that meany opening the mail, "show headers", copy the real name out of it), changing back to the new contact and add the real name.

![k9-screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3306424/14171385/f259361c-f732-11e5-9f39-c86714e3b740.png)

This would help a lot,
thanks in advance!
Spectas
### Environment

K-9 Mail version:
5.008
Android version:
5.1.1 (Cyanogenmod 12.1)
Account type: IMAP + CardDAV (DAVdroid)
